result.execSummary:
The defendant Damien F Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).  Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  

Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

No contact with victims or their residences.
No contact with Jaime Clark-Morris unless approved by agent for purposes of parenting Damien Jr.
No contact with James Dixon.
  Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Agent to be informed of all prescriptions. All prescriptions to be kept in original containers.
  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.

Submit to DNA sample. Surcharge waived
Random drug testing.
  Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment

supervisions.notes: Court costs waived by the Court.

Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty.  Matter set over for sentencing. Upon a plea to Ct 2 the State will be recommending a prison sentence, restitution and no contact with victim. Count 4 dismissed and read in.
